capTable.title: Cap Table
capTable.description: A record of who owns the company and in what proportions. Used to understand control, dilution, and how exit proceeds would be shared.

valuation.title: Company Valuation
valuation.description: What the company is considered to be worth for funding or exit purposes. Valuation directly drives share price and investor ownership.

sharePrice.title: Share Price
sharePrice.description: The price of one share, typically calculated as valuation divided by total shares. Determines how much ownership an investor buys with their capital.

fullyDiluted.title: Fully Diluted Shares
fullyDiluted.description: The total shares that would exist if all options, convertibles, SAFEs, and other rights were exercised. Reflects the 'real' ownership picture investors care about.

issuedShares.title: Issued Shares
issuedShares.description: Shares that have actually been issued and are currently owned. Does not include potential future shares from options or convertibles.

authorizedShares.title: Authorised Shares
authorizedShares.description: The maximum number of shares the company is legally allowed to issue. Creates headroom for future fundraising, ESOP grants, and conversions.

investorType.title: Investor Type
investorType.description: Categories of shareholders (Founders, Angels, VCs, Employees, Strategic). Different types may have different goals, rights, and return expectations.

ownership.title: Ownership Percentage
ownership.description: The investorâ€™s share of the company, expressed as a percentage. Determines influence, dilution exposure, and exit value.

proRataRights.title: Pro-Rata Rights
proRataRights.description: Allows an investor to buy into future rounds to maintain their ownership percentage. Protects against dilution and is valuable in high-growth companies.

totalInvested.title: Total Invested
totalInvested.description: The total capital the investor has put into the company. Useful for comparing investment size to ownership, return, and participation.

currentShares.title: Current Shares
currentShares.description: The number of shares currently owned, factoring in sales, transfers, or conversions. Used to calculate ownership percentage.

exitedInvestor.title: Exited Investor
exitedInvestor.description: An investor who has sold or transferred their entire position. They no longer participate in future returns or dilution.

fundingRound.title: Funding Round
fundingRound.description: A capital raise event where new shares are issued to investors. Each round changes ownership, valuation, and dilution.

preMoneyValuation.title: Pre-Money Valuation
preMoneyValuation.description: What the company is valued at immediately before new investment. Determines how much ownership new investors receive for their money.

postMoneyValuation.title: Post-Money Valuation
postMoneyValuation.description: Valuation after new investment (Pre-Money + New Capital). Used to understand dilution and investor ownership after the round.

amountRaised.title: Amount Raised
amountRaised.description: The total capital raised in a round. Higher raises typically mean more dilution unless valuation rises accordingly.

roundType.title: Round Type
roundType.description: Describes the stage of funding (Pre-Seed, Seed, Series A/B/C, Bridge). Different stages signal different levels of risk and expected return.

leadInvestor.title: Lead Investor
leadInvestor.description: The investor setting the terms and valuation of a round. Often receives negotiation advantages and board representation.

pricePerShare.title: Price Per Share
pricePerShare.description: How much each new share costs in the round. Higher prices mean less dilution for the same raise amount.

shareClass.title: Share Class
shareClass.description: Different types of shares carry different economic or control rights. Investors typically hold preference shares; founders/employees hold ordinary.

ordinary.title: Ordinary Shares
ordinary.description: Basic ownership shares with standard voting rights. Typically held by founders and employees; receive proceeds after preference shares.

preference.title: Preference Shares
preference.description: Investor shares with enhanced rights such as liquidation preference or anti-dilution protection. Improve investor downside protection.

option.title: Options
option.description: Rights to purchase shares in the future at a set price. Common in employee compensation; represent future dilution to investors.

performanceRights.title: Performance Rights
performanceRights.description: Rights that convert into shares on meeting performance conditions. AUS-friendly structure for ESS schemes with no strike price.

liquidationPreference.title: Liquidation Preference
liquidationPreference.description: Gives preference shareholders priority in an exit. They get paid first before ordinary shareholders, reducing investor downside.

transactionType.title: Transaction Type
transactionType.description: Describes how shares change hands (Issue, Transfer, Exercise, Sale). Different types affect dilution and cap table differently.

issue.title: Share Issue
issue.description: Creation of new shares, typically during fundraising or exercise. Increases total shares and dilutes existing holders.

transfer.title: Share Transfer
transfer.description: Movement of existing shares between parties. Does not change total shares; ownership shifts without dilution.

exercise.title: Option Exercise
exercise.description: Converts an option into a share by paying the strike price. Creates new shares and increases dilution.

exercisePrice.title: Exercise/Strike Price
exercisePrice.description: The price paid to exercise an option. Higher strike prices reduce the economic value for employees and increase capital to the company.

buyback.title: Share Buyback
buyback.description: Company repurchases its own shares, reducing total shares. Can consolidate ownership or tidy employee exits.

secondarySale.title: Secondary Sale
secondarySale.description: Shares sold between investors. No new shares issued and the company does not receive funds.

reequitization.title: Re-equitization
reequitization.description: Resetting employee equity (often options) after a valuation drop. Re-aligns incentives at the cost of dilution.

vesting.title: Vesting
vesting.description: Shares become earned over time or milestones. Protects the company from issuing unearned equity and aligns incentives.

cliff.title: Cliff Period
cliff.description: An initial period where nothing vests. If someone leaves before the cliff, the company retains all unvested shares.

vestingPeriod.title: Vesting Period
vestingPeriod.description: The full schedule over which shares vest. Longer schedules align with long-term retention and value creation.

acceleration.title: Acceleration
acceleration.description: Fast forwarding vesting due to an acquisition or termination. Impacts exit payouts and employee incentives.

timeBased.title: Time-Based Vesting
timeBased.description: Shares vest based on time served. Standard for employees and founders; predictable and retention-focused.

milestoneBased.title: Milestone Vesting
milestoneBased.description: Shares vest when targets are achieved. Aligns with measurable company performance and short-term value creation.

hoursBased.title: Hours-Based Vesting
hoursBased.description: Shares vest based on hours worked. Useful for part-time or advisory contributions where time commitment varies.

hybridVesting.title: Hybrid Vesting
hybridVesting.description: Combines time, milestone, or hours-based vesting. Allows tailored incentive structures for key hires or founders.

reverseVesting.title: Reverse Vesting
reverseVesting.description: Shares are issued upfront but subject to buyback if vesting conditions aren't met. Common for founders where value is created over time.

goodLeaver.title: Good Leaver
goodLeaver.description: Leaving on friendly terms (retirement, redundancy, disability). Typically receives fairer treatment on vested equity.

badLeaver.title: Bad Leaver
badLeaver.description: Leaving on unfavourable terms (resignation or termination for cause). Usually forfeits unvested equity and may lose additional rights.

lapsing.title: Lapsing / Forfeiture
lapsing.description: Unvested equity is cancelled and often returned to the ESOP pool. Reduces dilution for other holders and resets incentives.

convertibleNote.title: Convertible Note
convertibleNote.description: A loan that turns into shares in a future round. Offers downside protection and exposure to upside, making it attractive for early investors.

safe.title: SAFE
safe.description: Simple Agreement for Future Equity. Converts into shares in a later priced round without interest or maturity. Investor-friendly in high-growth scenarios.

valuationCap.title: Valuation Cap
valuationCap.description: The maximum valuation at which a convertible converts. Ensures early investors receive a better price than late-stage investors.

discount.title: Conversion Discount
discount.description: A percentage discount applied to the share price on conversion. Rewards early risk-taking and improves investor return.

maturityDate.title: Maturity Date
maturityDate.description: When a convertible note must convert or be repaid. Forces a financing event and reduces investor uncertainty.

qualifyingRound.title: Qualifying Round
qualifyingRound.description: A funding event that triggers conversion. Ensures conversion happens only in meaningful priced rounds.

conversionShares.title: Estimated Conversion Shares
conversionShares.description: An estimate of how many shares a convertible will convert into. Helps investors model dilution and future ownership.

dilution.title: Dilution
dilution.description: Ownership percentages decrease as new shares are issued. Dilution is not always negative if valuation increases faster than share count.

antiDilution.title: Anti-Dilution Protection
antiDilution.description: Investor rights that issue extra shares if a down round occurs. Protects investor ownership and return profile.

downRound.title: Down Round
downRound.description: A round priced lower than the previous one. Increases dilution for existing shareholders and often triggers anti-dilution or option repricing.

proRataCalculation.title: Pro-Rata Investment
proRataCalculation.description: The amount an investor must invest to keep their ownership percentage steady in a new round. Helps defend against dilution.

esop.title: ESOP / Option Pool
esop.description: Shares reserved for employee equity compensation. Expanding the pool increases dilution but strengthens talent incentives.

esopDilution.title: ESOP Dilution Method
esopDilution.description: Describes whether the ESOP pool dilutes founders, new investors, or both. Often negotiated as part of funding terms.

allocated.title: Allocated Options
allocated.description: Options granted to employees. Represent committed dilution.

unallocated.title: Unallocated Pool
unallocated.description: Options not yet granted. Future hiring and retention tool, and a source of expected dilution.

poolExpansion.title: Pool Expansion
poolExpansion.description: Increasing ESOP size. Typically negotiated before a round and dilutes all holders unless otherwise structured.

essTax.title: ESS Tax Rules (Australia)
essTax.description: Rules governing how employee equity is taxed in Australia. Impacts the attractiveness of options and performance rights.

startupConcession.title: ESS Startup Concession
startupConcession.description: Tax concessions for eligible startups that defer tax on employee equity and reduce upfront burden. Important for early hiring.

division83A.title: Division 83A
division83A.description: The tax law section covering employee equity. Dictates taxing points and how heavily equity is taxed.

taxingPoint.title: Taxing Point
taxingPoint.description: The moment equity becomes taxable (grant, vest, exercise, or sale). Influences employee preferences for options vs rights.

exitWaterfall.title: Exit Waterfall
exitWaterfall.description: Shows how exit proceeds are distributed among shareholders. Preference shares get paid first, then ordinary. Determines investor returns.

dilutionCalculator.title: Dilution Calculator
dilutionCalculator.description: Models how ownership changes with new rounds. Helps investors evaluate how much share they lose versus value gained.

roundSimulator.title: Round Simulator
roundSimulator.description: Simulates a future raise, including ESOP expansion and convertible conversions. Helps forecast valuation, dilution, and ownership.

participatingPreferred.title: Participating Preferred
participatingPreferred.description: Preference shares that get their preference paid first and then participate pro rata. Increases investor returns relative to ordinary.

nonParticipatingPreferred.title: Non-Participating Preferred
nonParticipatingPreferred.description: Preference shares that choose either their preference or pro rata participation. Balanced between investor protection and founder upside.

companyName.title: Company Name
companyName.description: Legal registered name of the company (Australia: ASIC registry).

investorName.title: Investor Name
investorName.description: Name of the shareholder or investing entity. Used for ownership attribution and payout calculations.

numberOfShares.title: Number of Shares
numberOfShares.description: Amount of shares associated with a holding or transaction. Used to calculate ownership and dilution.

roundName.title: Round Name
roundName.description: Label for a funding round (Seed, Series A). Helps track ownership over time.

transactionDate.title: Transaction Date
transactionDate.description: Date shares were issued, transferred, or cancelled. Important for valuation, vesting, and tax.

vestingStartDate.title: Vesting Start Date
vestingStartDate.description: When vesting begins. Impacts retention, tax treatment, and acceleration.

cliffMonths.title: Cliff (Months)
cliffMonths.description: Months before vesting begins. Protects the company from early departures.

vestingMonths.title: Vesting Period (Months)
vestingMonths.description: Total timeline for vesting to complete. Longer durations reduce turnover risk and align incentives.
